item.title: PNP warns anti-vaccine protestors who defy health protocols
item.description: Philippine National Police chief Police General Guillermo Eleazar on Sunday warned individuals and groups that purposely defied quarantine health regulations to hold protests against the COVID-19 vaccines.

item.title: Johannesburg, S.Africa mayor killed in car accident
item.description: The mayor of Johannesburg was killed in a car accident as he returned from campaigning with South Africa's president on Saturday, just over a month after being elected, his office said in a statement.

item.title: Biden asks for early talks with Macron amid submarine row
item.description: US President Joe Biden has requested early talks with French President Emmanuel Macron, France said on Sunday, in an apparent effort to mend fences after a row over a submarines contract sparked rare tensions between the allies.

item.title: France denies canceling meeting with Swiss president over jet snub
item.description: aris denied Swiss media reports Sunday that a long-planned meeting between the countries' presidents in Paris had been called off due to French anger about Bern's decision to purchase US, not French, fighter jets.

item.title: Hong Kong elite selects powerful new patriots only committee
item.description: Hong Kong's political elite began selecting a powerful committee on Sunday which will choose the city's next leader and nearly half the legislature under a new "patriots only" system imposed by Beijing.

item.title: New Zealand sees small increase in daily COVID-19 cases over weekend
item.description: New Zealand reported 24 new locally acquired coronavirus cases on Sunday, up from 20 on Saturday, showing an upturn after several days of lower numbers, as the country's largest city Auckland awaits to hear if its lockdown restrictions will ease.

item.title: 3 million more Sinovac doses arrive
item.description: Three million additional doses of government-procured Sinovac COVID-19 vaccine arrived in the country on Sunday.

item.title: Duterte to address UN General Assembly
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte is set to participate in the High-Level General Debate of the 76th Session of the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) from September 21 to 27.

item.title: Australia rejects French accusations of lying over subs deal
item.description: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison on Sunday rejected France's accusations Canberra lied about plans to cancel a contract to buy French submarines, saying he had raised concerns over the deal "some months ago."

item.title: Pacquiao chosen as PDP-Laban faction standard bearer for Eleksyon 2022
item.description: Senator Emmanuel “Manny” Pacquiao on Sunday accepted the Partido Demokratiko Pilipino - Lakas ng Bayan (PDP-Laban) nomination to be the party s presidential candidate in the upcoming 2022 national elections.

item.title: PNP: Cops with COVID-19 now at 38,219
item.description: The Philippine National Police on Sunday reported 162 new cases of the novelcoronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) among its personnel, bringing the total tally to 38,219.

item.title: New Philippine COVID-19 infections hit 19,271; active cases at 178,196
item.description: The Philippines reported 19,271 new COVID-19 infections on Sunday, raising the number of active cases in the country to 178,196.

item.title: Eleazar orders probe into death of delivery rider in Tondo
item.description: Philippine National Police chief Police General Guillermo Eleazar ordered an investigation into the death of a delivery rider in Tondo, Manila involving a police officer.

item.title: Pimentel insists on faction's legitimacy; vows to fight hijackers of PDP-Laban
item.description: Senator Aquilino "Koko" Pimentel III on Sunday insisted that they were the legitimate representatives of PDP-Laban and that they would fight hijackers of their party.

item.title: Gov't should be cooperative in ICC drug war probe --Pimentel
item.description: Senator Aquilino "Koko" Pimentel III on Sunday said the national government needs to be cooperative in the International Criminal Court's (ICC) investigation of drug war killings as well as deaths in Davao City under President Rodrigo Duterte's leadership.
